children.subject: No, CS 70 is still required.  It is listed a math course under the requirements.
Wait, so CS 70 just got made optional for EECS majors? Why is this the case?

Please try a simple google search before posting

http://physics.berkeley.edu/news-events/news/20170720/physics-launches-new-series-5-lab-courses
Since its more physics major oriented, I assume the class material is more difficult than 7 series?
What's the difference between the 5 series and 7 series physics?
No, these are two different requirements. This has not changed.
Can the 3rd natural science course also be part of the 4 unit technical elective requirement?
Clarification: This is effective Fall 2018, and does not apply to Summer 2018 graduates.
Can the natural science elective be taken P/NP?

history.content:
Dear Students,

 

I am writing to inform you of curriculum changes to the EECS major that are effective Fall 2018 for all current, continuing, and new students.

 

Change 1

Reduction of the 45 technical College of Engineering units requirement to 40 units for all EECS and EECS/MET major students. For students who have taken the EECS coursework at UC Berkeley, this requirement will be fulfilled by:

  • 20 units of lower division EE or CS courses: CS 61A, CS 61B, CS 61C, EE 16A, EE 16B
  • 20 units of upper division EECS, EE, or CS courses

 

Change 2

Acknowledgment of the new Physics 5 series in the degree requirements for the EECS and EECS MET majors. Students may opt to take the Physics 5 series (5A, 5B, & 5BL) or the Physics 7 series (Physics 7A & 7B) to fulfill this requirement. Students who have fulfilled the first half of the Physics requirement through AP/IB test scores, transfer work, or with Physics 7A, may opt to fulfill the second half with Physics 7B or Physics 5B & 5BL. Completion of Physics 5A and 7B will not fulfill the requirement. All courses must be taken for a letter grade.

 

Change 3

Acknowledgment of the Physics 5 series in the “Natural Science Elective” degree requirements for the EECS and EECS MET majors. In addition to the courses currently accepted, students should be permitted to fulfill this requirement by completing Physics 5C and 5CL (must take both) for a letter grade.

 

These changes can now be seen on the Berkeley Academic Guide, and the new degree worksheet. They do not apply to Summer 2018 graduates.
history.subject: CHANGES TO REQUIREMENTS FOR EECS MAJORS

history.content:
Dear Students,

 

I am writing to inform you of curriculum changes to the EECS major that are effective immediately for all current, continuing, and new students.

 

Change 1

Reduction of the 45 technical College of Engineering units requirement to 40 units for all EECS and EECS/MET major students. For students who have taken the EECS coursework at UC Berkeley, this requirement will be fulfilled by:

  • 20 units of lower division EE or CS courses: CS 61A, CS 61B, CS 61C, EE 16A, EE 16B
  • 20 units of upper division EECS, EE, or CS courses

 

Change 2

Acknowledgment of the new Physics 5 series in the degree requirements for the EECS and EECS MET majors. Students may opt to take the Physics 5 series (5A, 5B, & 5BL) or the Physics 7 series (Physics 7A & 7B) to fulfill this requirement. Students who have fulfilled the first half of the Physics requirement through AP/IB test scores, transfer work, or with Physics 7A, may opt to fulfill the second half with Physics 7B or Physics 5B & 5BL. Completion of Physics 5A and 7B will not fulfill the requirement. All courses must be taken for a letter grade.

 

Change 3

Acknowledgment of the Physics 5 series in the “Natural Science Elective” degree requirements for the EECS and EECS MET majors. In addition to the courses currently accepted, students should be permitted to fulfill this requirement by completing Physics 5C and 5CL (must take both) for a letter grade.

 

These changes can now be seen on the Berkeley Academic Guide, and the new degree worksheet.
